growth_development.content: Newborns typically lose 5-10% of birth weight in first week, then gain 5-7 oz per week for first 6 months. Breastfed babies may gain weight more slowly than formula-fed babies.
Babies grow about 10 inches (25 cm) in their first year. Growth spurts occur around 2-3 weeks, 6 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months.
Head circumference increases rapidly in first year - about 2 cm per month for first 3 months, then 1 cm per month until 6 months.

sleep_patterns.content: Newborns sleep 14-17 hours per day in short bursts of 2-4 hours. Sleep patterns are irregular and day-night confusion is normal.
By 3-6 months, babies can sleep 4-6 hour stretches. Total sleep: 12-15 hours including naps. Night sleep becomes more consolidated.
Toddlers need 11-14 hours of sleep including 1-3 hour afternoon nap. Bedtime routines become very important.

nutrition_feeding.content: Newborns breastfeed 8-12 times per 24 hours. Feeding sessions last 15-45 minutes. Cluster feeding in evenings is normal.
Formula-fed babies eat 2-3 oz per feeding initially, increasing to 4-5 oz by 2 months. Feed every 3-4 hours.
Introduce solid foods around 6 months when baby can sit up, shows interest in food, and has lost tongue-thrust reflex. Start with single-ingredient foods.

common_symptoms.content: Keep area clean and dry. Use barrier cream with zinc oxide. Change diapers frequently. Air dry when possible. See doctor if severe or doesn't improve in 2-3 days.
Fever in babies under 3 months requires immediate medical attention. For older babies, fever over 100.4째F (38째C) should be monitored. Offer fluids and dress lightly.
Colic involves crying for 3+ hours a day, 3+ days a week. Try swaddling, white noise, gentle motion, and feeding position changes. Usually resolves by 3-4 months.

developmental_milestones.content: Smiles socially, follows objects with eyes, holds head up briefly during tummy time, makes cooing sounds.
Sits with support, rolls both ways, reaches for objects, babbles with consonants, shows curiosity about surroundings.
Walks with assistance or independently, says first words, understands simple commands, plays peek-a-boo, drinks from cup.

safety_guidelines.content: Always place babies on their back to sleep. Use firm sleep surface. No blankets, pillows, or toys in crib. Room-sharing without bed-sharing is recommended.
Rear-facing car seats until at least age 2 or until reaching seat's weight/height limits. Never place rear-facing seat in front of active airbag.
Cut food into small pieces. Avoid nuts, popcorn, hard candies, grapes (cut lengthwise), hot dogs (cut lengthwise then into pieces) for children under 4.

when_to_call_doctor.content: Call 911 for: difficulty breathing, blue lips/face, seizures, severe injury, unconsciousness, or severe allergic reaction.
Call doctor immediately for fever in babies under 3 months. For older babies, call if fever over 102째F (39째C) or lasts more than 24 hours with other symptoms.
Contact pediatrician if baby refuses to eat for several feedings, shows signs of dehydration, or has persistent vomiting/diarrhea.
